intro: Seseli serbicum, commonly known as Serbian seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the Balkan Peninsula and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of the carrot family. Seseli serbicum is often found in open woodlands and along rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
